intro: Burmeistera montana, commonly known as the mountain burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Burmeistera montana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
